news_header: Oddlygood acquires Rude Health, a British plant-based food company, aiming for nearly EUR 50 million in sales this year.
news_text: Oddlygood has acquired Rude Health, a British company specializing in plant-based foods, although the transaction is not expected to lead to immediate changes in product offerings or production. Oddlygood, which focuses on developing plant-based products, aims for net sales of nearly EUR 50 million this year. Rude Health offers a range of plant-based beverages, snacks, and other products sold in over 40 countries. The acquisition is seen as complementary to both companies' product lines and target markets. This marks Oddlygood's second acquisition, following the purchase of Nordic Plant in 2023. Since 2021, Oddlygood has operated as an independent entity owned by Valio and Mandatum Asset Management.
